court: St Dié with appellate jurisdiction of Change de Nancy

formal_accuser.name: Substitut for procureur général de Lorraine at St Dié
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: state prosecutor acting on denunciation by executed witch

confession.seduction_context: She had been working in a garden when a man dressed in red appeared, who said they did her great wrong to call her witch (as they already did); if she would believe in him he would defend her and protect her from any wrong, and he was a greater master than God
sabbat_activities: prevented hail as far as she could for fear of dearth

harms_alleged.target: wife of Claude du Sal, alias Griffon
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: as she passed her cleaning fruits and herbs outside her house

harms_alleged.target: 4 or 5 horses and three fine cows

testimony.quarrel_subject: deaths of animals; threatened to inform justice to avoid greater losses
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle luy en feroit mordre les doigts jusques a l'os (she would make him bite his fingers to the bone)

harms_alleged.target: horse which died as if rabid, pigs, fine goat worth 9 francs

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute between husbands over a small stream which flowed by garden belonging to the Claudes
father talked about boy expelled from village who had seen her at assembly, said some ought to be arrested

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude or others
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after quarrel, became ill and died

witnesses.name: Catherine veuve Thoussainct Colin Michiel Bejalley

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband used small piece of inherited land to enlarge house; accused was angry and threatened him saying house was not yet built or finished
testimony.threat_quote: house was not yet built or finished

harms_alleged.target: horse broke leg as last load of stone brought up; another horse died suddenly at same time following year; bull also lost

testimony.quarrel_subject: pig damaged Catherine's garden, row over compensation - husband would not pay because they did not make proper claim; Catherine angry, called them 'freilleux et pouilleux'

witnesses.name: Jehennon femme Claude de Sal, dit le Griffon

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused was refused straw by neighbor; witness secretly obtained straw from close friend who was frightened Catherine might harm her; Catherine reproached the neighbor despite precautions

harms_alleged.target: self - fell into frenzy, then had 'grand mal' in neck spreading to whole body, lost use of limbs for 9 months
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly afterwards when in company, saw Catherine approaching

witnesses.name: Laurence femme Demenge Grand Benay, de Repas

harms_alleged.target: daughter - broken arm from fall when strong branch broke while picking plums

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Substitut for procureur général de Lorraine at St Dié requests prévôt to take evidence; says Mathis Chemenel of Gemaingoutte (executed as witch) had denounced Catherine as accomplice, claiming to have seen her at several sabbats; also has very bad reputation

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: No reproaches from accused, but no admissions of any significance

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Procureur général de Lorraine (C-M. Remy) asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture request

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews, then rack, and finally strappado; became semi-conscious in later stages; maintained denials throughout. After lunch, confessed, saying sorry she had allowed herself to be tortured

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions, but discharged 3 of those she had accused (Hanzo Alexis, Beniste le Housse, Marion Bejollé) saying she held grudges against them

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

torture.requesting_official: C-M. Remy, procureur général de Lorraine

accomplices_named.name: Beniste le Housse femme Pierron de Norbepaire
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; later discharged - accused admitted she held grudge

accomplices_named.name: Hantzo Alexis
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat, described as having only one leg; later discharged - accused admitted she held grudge

accomplices_named.name: Marion (sister of Dion Bejollé)
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; later discharged - accused admitted she held grudge

prior_accusations.context: Denounced Catherine as accomplice at execution, claiming to have seen her at several sabbats

prior_accusations.accuser_name: woman executed at Val de Lusse
prior_accusations.context: Had accused Catherine as witch 8 years earlier (c. 1610)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Bertrand (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy en feroit mordre les doigts jusques a l'os
notable_quotes.english: she would make him bite his fingers to the bone
notable_quotes.context: Threat after Jean Bertrand threatened to inform justice about animal deaths

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Bertrand (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: comme pour l'inthimider il la menaca d'en faire prendre et d'en informer par justice affin d'eviter pertes plus grandes
notable_quotes.english: as if to intimidate her he threatened to have her arrested and inform justice in order to avoid greater losses
notable_quotes.context: After losing animals including a horse that died as if rabid

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Bertrand (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: Et ayant ainsy fantaisie que ladite prevenue luy avoit procuré les susdites pertes . . il estoit quelquefois en deliberation de l'exterminer luy mesme la rencontrant a l'escart, s'il n'eust jugé qu'il valloit mieux que ce fut par l'expedient de la justice
notable_quotes.english: And having such a notion that the said accused had procured the aforementioned losses...he was sometimes deliberating to exterminate her himself when meeting her alone, if he had not judged that it was better that it be by the expedient of justice
notable_quotes.context: Jean Bertrand's thoughts about taking matters into his own hands

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Claude le maire (witness 25)
notable_quotes.context: Insult Catherine hurled at witness and her husband during quarrel over compensation for pig damage

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (Joly) in confession
notable_quotes.english: they did her great wrong to call her witch (as they already did); if she would believe in him he would defend her and protect her from any wrong, and he was a greater master than God
notable_quotes.context: Seduction narrative - devil's promise to Catherine

relationships.evidence_text: Catherine femme Bertremin Claude de Wisembach

relationships.evidence_text: Accused was her aunt by marriage
Jean Thoussainct Colin Michiel (witness 10) mentions his brother's child; Demenge Toussainct Colin Michiel (witness 23) mentions when wife had been in childbed

relationships.person2: Claude de Sal, dit le Griffon
relationships.evidence_text: Jehennon femme Claude de Sal, dit le Griffon

economic_context.details: Dispute over stream by garden (witnesses 18-19). Dispute over compensation for pig damage to garden (witness 25). Debt of 11 gros mentioned between accused and witness 25. Land inheritance dispute - Catherine angry that nephew used inherited land to enlarge house (witness 21). Dispute over straw/hay mentioned (witnesses 8, 26).

material_culture.context: Used as test - placed above door to trap witch who caused illness; accused stayed until it was removed
Catherine sent a loaf to witness 25's house after witness confessed to curé that she attributed husband's death to Catherine
Accused confessed to paying a black hen every year to be exempted from attending sabbat more often
Devil gave her black powder to kill animals
Devil gave her grey powder to kill people

material_culture.object: money that proved to be leaves
material_culture.context: Devil gave her money which proved to be leaves
Last load of stone being brought up to build house when horse broke leg
Disputes over hay and straw allocation among neighbors
Accused passed witness who was cleaning fruits and herbs outside house
Daughter wanted to pick plums from tree, fell and broke arm
Debt of 11 gros mentioned between accused and witness 25

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial initiated by denunciation from executed witch Mathis Chemenel. Very long reputation (21 years mentioned by one witness). Notable features: (1) Broom test used multiple times by different witnesses to trap witch who caused illness - folkloric counter-magic practice; (2) Big black dog incident - shapeshifting narrative; (3) Jean Bertrand's testimony remarkable for explicitly stating he considered killing accused himself but decided to use legal justice instead; (4) Economic disputes prominent - property, hay/straw, compensation for damages; (5) Accused from Quebrux, resident of Wisembach; (6) Confession only after severe torture (thumbscrews, rack, strappado to point of semi-consciousness); (7) Accused strategically retracted 3 accusations after confession, admitting grudges - shows some agency even under duress; (8) C-M. Remy (author of Demonolatry) was procureur général; (9) Change de Nancy approved torture and death sentence; (10) Executed August 15, 1618. Location names: some spelling variations in original (Wissembach/Wisembach, Gemaingotte/Gemaingoutte). Witness 25 particularly detailed - confession to curé about attributing husband's death to Catherine, Catherine's ambiguous gift of loaf afterward. Young boy's testimony (via witness 15) about assemblies with unsalted meat, purple dress, dancing - vivid sabbat imagery from child's perspective.
